name: YIO CHU KANG PRIMARY SCHOOL
mrt: Hougang MRT Station Yio Chu Kang MRT Station

GeneralInformation.School Vision: Empowering Mind, Engaging Heart, Extending Hands
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture Confident and Self-Directed Learners who are Keen to Serve
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: In Yio Chu Kang Primary, we believe that every child has the potential to learn and achieve. Guided by our school philosophy, we seek to bring out the best in every child.  We are committed to ignite the joy of learning in every child and provide opportunities for discovery and exploration. We bring up the happy child who is confident, curious and caring. The child will learn to interact well with his peers, think critically and take responsibility for his learning. Learning and teaching in YCKPS is guided by the school's Curriculum Framework. Central to the Curriculum Framework is the school's vision, Empowering Mind, Engaging Heart, Extending Hands. The ultimate goal of our Curriculum is to develop every YCKPS student into the Self-directed Learner, Confident Person, Concerned Citizen, and Active Contributor. The school harnesses five key learning approaches, Differentiation, Authenticity and Relevance, Experiential, Collaboration and Integration, to provide enriching and engaging experiences for the holistic development of our students.   Through our academic programmes, we build in every child a strong foundation in literacy and numeracy. Our school-based curriculum creates experiences that enable our learners to see connections across disciplines and acquire competencies such as critical thinking, collaboration and communication skills that will enable them to thrive in the fast-changing future landscape.   We imbue in our learners core values so that they grow up to be morally upright individuals who are globally aware while being rooted as Singaporeans. The school's values of Caring, Upright, Progressive and Excellence are constantly reinforced to guide both staff and students in their thoughts, actions and behaviour. We provide opportunities for our students to reflect on the needs of the community and how they could serve others by putting their values in action. Through this, we nurture the 'Youth of Character, Keen to Serve'.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Developing Skills and Values through T.E.A.M Sports@YCKPS

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Learning for Life Programme - Developing Skills and Values through T.E.A.M Sports@YCK The school imbues values and develops skills through collaborative learning involving the dynamics of team sports. A 3-tiered whole school approach is deployed: 1.Character Through Sports: Students participate in team sports such as Basketball and Frisbee during where school values are inculcated. 2.Sports for All: This holistic programme, through the approach of Exploration, Exposure and Development, broadens students' sporting experiences and enhance their growth and development. 3.Sports for Excellence: Students who demonstrate potential and aptitude in niche sports of Football and Volleyball are placed in the Talent Development programme. Platforms like inter-school competitions hone their skills and equip them with values and mental strength to be confident, resilient and strong team players.  Interdisciplinary Project Work (IPW) IPW, integrated with Values-in-Action activities promotes inquiry and enables students to appreciate inter-connectedness across disciplines. Students acquire 21st century competencies such as critical thinking, collaboration, communication skills and develop care and empathy for environmental concerns. Students co-construct their understanding of real world problems and apply new knowledge in creative and meaningful ways to solve problems.  School Values Education Programme Values-in-Action(VIA): The 6-year programme imbues in students civic-mindedness and nurtures them into caring citizens. The VIA activities, themed "Our Environment", where learning spiraled from keeping the classrooms and school clean to student-initiated projects that addresses social concerns.  Values Express: Using LEGO bricks, students construct and articulate their interpretation and understanding of the significance of the school values. Through the 4C(Connect,Construct,Contemplate,Continue) approach, students take an active role in the learning process to express themselves.
